author: JuliaRegistrator

comments.body:
Can you add
```toml
[compat]
julia = "1"
```
to the project file and retrigger the bot?

Could you delete the Package from the META? I found one with equal
functionality.

On Mon, 27 May 2019, 23:07 Fredrik Ekre, <notifications@github.com> wrote:

> Can you add
>
> [compat]julia = "1"
>
> to the project file and retrigger the bot?
>
> â€”
> You are receiving this because you were mentioned.
> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
> <https://github.com/JuliaRegistries/General/pull/993?email_source=notifications&email_token=ACEDX54MVXULD4RSLSCGK73PXREP3A5CNFSM4HPVSE72YY3PNVWWK3TUL52HS4DFVREXG43VMVBW63LNMVXHJKTDN5WW2ZLOORPWSZGODWKQMZY#issuecomment-496305767>,
> or mute the thread
> <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/ACEDX52HJY6LALDUQNU3XCLPXREP3ANCNFSM4HPVSE7Q>
> .
>
Hi @fraxx001 ! Which registered package has the same functionality?

Hi @diegozea @> operator in Lazy.jl does the same thing in a more elegant way. My long term plan was to define a macro which finds the right argument spot for the passed argument by comparing datatypes but I figured out that this is not possible.
